locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the metaphor of 'ransom' and 'invasion' to explain the atonement, contrasting biblical witness with cultural artifacts like the Shroud of Turin, Joan of Arc, and modern film.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Detailed focus on the 'Son of Man' title and the Greek concept of 'lutron' (ransom) within its historical-biblical context.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the nature of Christ's work, but shifts into promising and declaring toward the conclusion.
voorbeelden: The Son of Man came... to give his life as a ransom.
You were bought with a price.
I am sure that neither death nor life... will be able to separate us.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from being a spectator (compassion for Jesus) to a participant (liberated hostage/soldier).
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The sermon relies on the 'living and active Word' but does not explicitly invoke the Spirit's current agency.

voorbeelden: Belief in Jesus does not come from venerating relics.
The New Testament sees the situation very much in these terms.
Think about it for a moment.
I happen to be a big Joan of Arc fan.
I wish I had had the presence of mind.
He will also give us all things with him.
Nothing will be able to separate us from the love of God.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly biblical, though often quoted as Scripture rather than direct 'I-Thou' address from the preacher.

voorbeelden: The price for our complicity... has already been paid.
This coming of the Son of Man is for you.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher uses the authority of the text to declare a new status for the hearer.

indicatoren: Extensive discussion of film reviews and historical anecdotes.
Lengthy explanation of metaphors (ransom vs invasion).
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a well-informed student of theology rather than a ransomed captive.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final third of the sermon.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological quality, specifically addressing the hearer's vulnerability.
voorbeelden: This coming of the Son of Man is for you.
The price... has already been paid.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the hearer's condition and calling.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used effectively in the 'If you... then this is for you' section.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Jesus, Joan of Arc, and the world.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the first half.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical narrative of the Cross and Joan of Arc.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions of ransom and sin.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Now' of the Gospel's claim on the hearer.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (explanation of ransom) to Declarative (the price is paid) to Commissive (God is for you) to Directive (enlist).
voorbeelden: The price... has already been paid (Dec) -> If God is for us (Com) -> Enlist in the underground (Dir).

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: The big stuff has already been done... Our part is mostly to be foot soldiers.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a heavy constative start, the sermon successfully transitions into a performative event by the end, where the Word is applied as a liberating force.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Nothing... will be able to separate us.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lengthy discussion of the Shroud of Turin and movie reviews.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it stops talking about 'ransom' as a concept and starts declaring the hearer as 'ransomed'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'This is for you' functions sacramentally.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the extensive use of Scripture as a 'living Word'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher speaks as one authorized to 'enlist' others.
tekstueel_bewijs: What he says... is a living Word for us.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly via the 'living and active' nature of the Word.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher presents the news and calls for enlistment, leaving the 'spiritual experience' to the nature of the news itself.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the 'invasion of grace'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, especially the 'Aslan has landed' imagery.
tekstueel_bewijs: This coming of the Son of Man is for you.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs in the first half; strong 'will' and 'are' verbs in the second.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The New Testament sees the situation very much in these terms.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The New Testament declares that you are currently being liberated.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a description of a viewpoint to a declaration of reality.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the 'This is for you' structure.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you that your ransom is paid.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: First half is too third-person heavy.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the 'you' earlier in the historical analysis.
voorbeeldzinnen: When Jesus spoke of a ransom, he was looking at you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the 'foot soldier' metaphor as it flows perfectly from the indicative of the 'heavy artillery'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A robust example of how theological depth can eventually bloom into performative power, provided the preacher moves past the 'lecture' phase.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies the declaration 'The price is paid' as a reality-changing act, not just 'information' or 'self-revelation'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power lies in the Commissive (God's promise) rather than the preacher's metaphors.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event' status is saved by the shift from Assertives to Declaratives in the final act.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The price for our complicity... has already been paid.

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the 'ransom' metaphor to bridge the gap between historical event and present reality.
